00012 #ifndef DILOG_H_
00013 #define DILOG_H_
00014 
00015 /* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
00016  * Dilogarithm function template definitions.  *
00017  *                                             *
00018  * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * */                                            
00019 
00020 #include <complex>
00021 #include <Camgen/Legendre.h>
00022 
00023 /* Order of the dilogarithm series evaluation: */
00024 
00025 #define DILOG_SERIES_ORDER 50
00026 
00027 /* Order of the Gauss quadrature integration: */
00028 
00029 #define INTEGRATION_ORDER 15
00030 
00031 /* Numerical constant \pi^2/6: */
00032 
00033 #define PI_SQ_OVER_SIX 1.644934066848226
00034 
00035 namespace Camorra
00036 {
00037 
00038     /* Function template evaluating the series x^k/k^2 up to the DILOG_SERIES_ORDER
00039      * integer: */
00040 
00041     template<class value_t>value_t dilog_series(const value_t& x)
00042     {
00043         value_t temp=x;
00044         value_t result=temp;
00045         for(unsigned n=2;n<DILOG_SERIES_ORDER;++n)
00046         {
00047             temp*=x;
00048             result+=temp/(value_t)(n*n);
00049         }
00050         return result;
00051     }
00052 
00053     /* Helper function for real-valued dilogarithm evaluation; if 1/2 < x < 1, the
00054      * dilogarithm series converges slowly, and the fomula
00055      *
00056      * Li2(1-z)=-Li2(z)-log(z)log(1-z)+\pi^2/6
00057      *
00058      * is applied before series expansion: */
00059 
00060     template<class value_t>value_t dilog_helper(const value_t& x)
00061     {
00062         return (x<0.5)?dilog_series(x):(-dilog_series((value_t)1-x)-std::log(x)*std::log((value_t)1-x)+(value_t)PI_SQ_OVER_SIX);
00063     }
00064 
00065     /* Helper function for complex-valued dilogarithm evaluation; if |z| < 0.5, the
00066      * series expansion converges rapidly enough, if 0.5 < |z| < 1, Gauss quadrature
00067      * is used to evaluate the integral: */
00068 
00069     template<class value_t>std::complex<value_t> dilog_helper(const std::complex<value_t>& z)
00070     {
00071         if(std::abs(z)<(value_t)0.5)
00072         {
00073             return dilog_series(z);
00074         }
00075         else
00076         {
00077             std::complex<value_t>result(0,0);
00078             std::complex<value_t>w(1,0);
00079             value_t t;
00080             for(unsigned i=0;i<INTEGRATION_ORDER;++i)
00081             {
00082                 t=(value_t)0.5*(Legendre<value_t,INTEGRATION_ORDER>::root(i)+(value_t)1);
00083                 result-=(value_t)0.5*Legendre<value_t,INTEGRATION_ORDER>::weight(i)*std::log(w-t*z)/t;
00084             }
00085             return result;
00086         }
00087     }
00088 
00089     /* Dilogarithm function template for real arguments. If -1 < x < 1, the helper
00090      * function is directly applied, if x < -1, the formula
00091      *
00092      * Li2(1/z)=-Li2(z)-log(-z)^2/2-\pi^2/6
00093      *
00094      * is applied. */
00095 
00097     
00098     template<class value_t>value_t Li2(const value_t& x)
00099     {
00100         if(x==(value_t)0)
00101         {
00102             return x;
00103         }
00104         if(x<-(value_t)1)
00105         {
00106             value_t l=std::log(-x);
00107             return -dilog_helper((value_t)1/x)-(value_t)0.5*l*l-(value_t)PI_SQ_OVER_SIX;
00108         }
00109         else if(x<-(value_t)0.5)
00110         {
00111             return (value_t)0.5*dilog_helper(x*x)-dilog_helper(-x);
00112         }
00113         else if(x<1)
00114         {
00115             return dilog_helper(x);
00116         }
00117         return HUGE_VAL;
00118     }
00119 
00120     /* Dilogarithm function template for complex arguments. If |z| < 1, the helper
00121      * function is directly applied else the formula
00122      *
00123      * Li2(1/z)=-Li2(z)-log(-z)^2/2-\pi^2/6
00124      *
00125      * is applied. */
00126 
00127     
00129     
00130     template<class value_t>std::complex<value_t> Li2(const std::complex<value_t>& z)
00131     {
00132         if(std::abs(z)<(value_t)1)
00133         {
00134             return dilog_helper(z);
00135         }
00136         else if(!(z.imag()==(value_t)0 and z.real()>(value_t)1))
00137         {
00138             std::complex<value_t>l=std::log(-z);
00139             return -dilog_helper(std::complex<value_t>(1,0)/z)-(value_t)0.5*l*l-std::complex<value_t>(PI_SQ_OVER_SIX,0);
00140         }
00141         return HUGE_VAL;
00142     }
00143 }
00144 
00145 #undef DILOG_SERIES_ORDER
00146 #undef PI_SQ_OVER_SIX
00147 #undef INTEGRATION_ORDER
00148 
00149 #endif /*DILOG_H_*/
